intro: Ligustrum perrottetii, commonly known as the Perrottetii privet, is a species of flowering plant in the Oleaceae family. It is native to China and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and dark green, glossy leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it adaptable to various garden conditions. Ligustrum perrottetii is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
